text: [Music]
job interview skills a program to master
the difficult stages and situations in a
job interview now let's understand what
are different types of interviews the
interview can be classified into five
basic types telephonic interview
technical interview behavioral interview
stress interview and HR interview
telephone screening interview telephonic
interviews have become an important part
of the interviewing process employers
might contact you anytime either
formally or informally they may call to
request additional information set up a
formal interview reschedule a time or
simply to chat with you to gain a better
understanding of your qualifications
phone interviews are also used as a
first round screening measure for
employers to decide on who they would
like to invite for the face-to-face
interviews since it is not face-to-face
interview many individuals tend to take
telephonic interviews rather lightly
this is a mistake remember that your
personality is reflected in your tone
and speech telephonic interviews often
reveal more to the interviewer then you
had perhaps imagined for instance if you
recline on a couch and speak casually
the listener at the other end can sense
your casual attitude therefore it is
important to maintain a professional
poise even during phone interviews
mind your telephone etiquette ensure
your voices or tone is clear speak
slowly with appropriate stresses and
pauses take down notes and respond
precisely to questions
technical interview a technical round of
interview judges the following
attributes in you how innovative you are
that is your ability to think outside
the box to come up with new solutions
rather than just spout the party line of
the moment whether you have a hands-on
experience with the relevant products or
technologies or you merely have an
economic knowledge of the same how
diverse your knowledge is specifically
to screen whether your knowledge is
limited to a specific stream or
technology or domain or you have a
broader base of knowledge that is
necessary in today's modern fast
changing work environments behavior l
interview a common type of job interview
in the modern workplace
is the behavior L interview this is
intended to assess the most common
traits or behavioral patterns you are
likely to demonstrate in a professional
situation the interviewers tend to ask
questions about general situations with
the candidate asked to describe how they
have handled or would handle a specific
problem typical behavior L interview
questions are describe a time you had to
work with someone you did not like tell
me about a time when you had to stick by
a decision you had made even though it
made you very unpopular give us an
example of something particularly
innovative that you have done that made
a difference in the workplace what was
the last time you were late with the
project
the goal of this interview is to assess
the candidates ability to respond to
different sorts of situations that the
job may present them with the questions
asked will therefore be based on the
core value systems and beliefs that you
bring to the table like honesty
timeliness decision-making creative
thinking etc stress interview stress
interviews are where the employer uses a
succession of interviewers to intimidate
the candidate and keep him or her
off-balance to find out candidates
ability to handle stress stress
interviews may involve testing the
applicants behavior in a busy and
unpredictable environment questions
about handling work overload dealing
with multiple projects and handling
conflict and typical situations are
generally asked during a stress
interview another type of stress
interview may involve only a single
interviewer who behaves in an interested
or hostile style for example the
interviewer may not give eye contact may
roll their eyes or sigh at the
candidates answer interrupts turn his
back take phone calls during the
interview and ask questions in the
demeaning or challenging style the goal
is to assess how the interviewee handles
pressure or to purposely evoke emotional
responses
the key to success for the candidate is
to de personalize the process the
interviewer is acting a role
deliberately and calculatedly once the
candidate realizes that there is nothing
behind the interviewers approach it is
easier to handle the questions examples
of stress interview questions sticky
situation if you've got a colleague
cheating on his expenses what would you
do putting you on the spot how do you
feel this interview is going at ball
question what would you change about the
design of the hockey stick
doubting your veracity I don't feel like
we're getting to the heart of the matter
here
start again tell me what really makes
you tick a char interview HR or Human
Resources interview with be conducted by
the people from the HR department of the
organization the interviewers here would
typically establish your antecedents
before you progress further and this
could also form a part of a telephone
interview this would typically be your
first interview after which the
organization may decide to send you the
ticket for the next phase in some cases
this could also be the final phase where
your position and compensation are
negotiated HR interviewers specifically
would like to understand the following
your fit with the role and
qualifications required how well you fit
with the culture of the organization and
team your commitment levels in the
professionalism you display on your job
how well you balance ambition and
leadership with the ability to follow
the organizational requirements values
like honesty and personal integrity
including whether you are able or
willing to say I don't know when you
don't know the answer to a question you
should specifically seek to understand
the following during this round
organizational culture policies and
benefits your role reporting
relationships and hierarchy the title
designation career band and compensation
levels joining benefits relocation
benefits expected date of joining etc
this was a demonstration video for job
interview skills for complete program
visit us at let's talk company dot in if
you liked this video kindly share your
comments which will encourage us to make
more videos for you you can also
subscribe to our YouTube channel by
clicking subscribe button just above
this video thank you for watching us
take care
[Music]
